Detailed Description

Author: Jaakko Luttinen Seeking projectile selects a target and tries to steer straight towards the target.

Constructs a new projectile.

Parameters:
name Name of the projectile.

price Price of the projectile.
spriteIndex Index of the sprite.
soundIndex Index of the firing sound.
explosionIndex Index of the explosion type.
radius Radius of the projectile.
mass Mass of the projectile.
damage Maximum damage of the projectile.
damageRadius Radius of the damage.
timeToTarget Time to activate.
acceleration The acceleration of steering.

Member Function Documentation

virtual Projectile* ProjectileSeeking::getCopy (   )  const [inline, virtual]
 

Returns a dynamic copy. Makes it possible to get a copy without knowing which subclass the object actually represents. Every subclass must overwrite this function.

Returns:
Dynamic copy of itself.

Reimplemented from Projectile.

Reimplemented in ProjectileSeekingBouncing.

void ProjectileSeeking::step (  int  timestep,
BodyProjectile &  capsule
)  [virtual]
 

Simulates the timestep for the capsule. If the targeting time has elapsed a target will be selected and the projectile directed straightly towards it.

Parameters:
timestep The step length in ms.
capsule The capsule, that is the projectile in the world.

Reimplemented from Projectile.
